This seems to be different. Notice this line in your log:

Root exception:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Cannot create configuration in
file:/C:/eclipse/configuration/

Is there something special with access rights to the "C:/eclipse/configuration/" directory on your compluter?

If problem persists, few things to try:
1. Run "eclipse -clean". If it still doesn't work:

2. Try to remove everything from the configuration directory except for config.ini (To be on the safe side, rename configuration directory into confguration.old, create a configuration directory, copy config.ini into it). If it still doesn't work:

3. Clean the Eclipse directory and re-install Eclipse.

Dear Oleg,
thanks for your reply.
I tried all your suggestions but still the program doesn't start. I also tried to choose a different configuration folder with the -configuration parameter.
Actually, I found out that virtually all my folders seem to contain some kind of write-protection - the checkbutton is checked in grey, and unchecking the box doesn't have an effect. However, I can create and remove folders without problems, and Eclipse doesn't seem to have problems writing in the configuration directory, as folders org.eclipse.osgi and org.eclipse.update have been successfully created.

Regards,
Markus

traces.message: The bundle could not be resolved. Reason: Missing Constraint: Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.core.jobs; bundle-version="[3.2.0,4.0.0)"
